snippet: The space shuttles are headed for museums, but NASA said Friday that more than 6,300 people responded to its latest call for would-be astronauts, the second highest in its history.
abstract: National Aeronautics and Space Administration says that more than 6,300 people responded to its latest call for would-be astronauts, the second highest in its history.
lead_paragraph: The space shuttles are headed for museums, but NASA said Friday that more than 6,300 people responded to its latest call for would-be astronauts, the second highest in its history.

headline.main: Job Seekers Still Drawn to Space
headline.print_headline: Job Seekers Still Drawn To Space
